meanings.definition: Directing something into a different channel or course.
meanings.sent1: She was rechanneling the water from the hose into the bucket.
meanings.sent2: The city council is rechanneling funds to support education programs.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved rechanneling the audience's attention from one hand to the other.
meanings.sent4: The coach is rechanneling the team's energy towards winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: By rechanneling the traffic to a different route, the construction crew avoided delays.

meanings.sent1: The engineer was rechanneling the river to prevent flooding.
meanings.sent2: The plumber is rechanneling the pipes to fix the leak.
meanings.sent3: The kids were rechanneling the stream of water from the hose onto the plants.
meanings.sent4: The wind was rechanneling the smoke away from the campfire.
meanings.sent5: The artist is rechanneling their creativity into a new project.

meanings.definition: Sending something in a new direction.
meanings.sent1: The captain was rechanneling the ship towards calmer waters.
meanings.sent2: The teacher is rechanneling the students' focus to the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: The chef was rechanneling the flavors in the dish to create a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: The storm was rechanneling the wind towards the open window.
meanings.sent5: The conductor is rechanneling the orchestra's performance to captivate the audience.
